info.title: Report
info.description:
Note

The Reports Publishing API and the Reports resource are available to Shopify Advanced and Shopify Plus merchants only.

You can use the Report resource to publish reports to the Reports page in the Shopify admin. For example, a shirt fulfillment app could publish a report that compares the sales of shirts by marketing campaign. The reports are based on queries written in ShopifyQL.

Reports are scoped to the app that created them. When an app creates a report, other apps can't view, modify, or delete that report. Also, apps can't access reports that were created from the Shopify admin.

Setting reports publishing permissions

To give reports publishing permissions to your app, add the write_reports permission to your OAuth requested scopes.

paths.description: Retrieves a list of reports. Note: As of version 2019-10, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Make paginated requests to the REST Admin API.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of report IDs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The amount of results to return.

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show reports last updated before date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show reports last updated after date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

reports.name: Custom App Report 2
reports.shopify_ql: SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales ORDER BY total_sales

reports.name: Wholesale Sales Report
reports.shopify_ql: SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today

response.body: {"reports":[{"id":752357116,"name":"Custom App Report 2","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales ORDER BY total_sales","updated_at":"2022-04-05T13:05:24-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"},{"id":517154478,"name":"Wholesale Sales Report","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today","updated_at":"2017-04-10T16:33:22-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"}]}

x-examples.name: Retrieve a list of all reports

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/reports.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Report.all(
  session: test_session,
)

response.body: {"reports":[{"id":517154478,"name":"Wholesale Sales Report","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today","updated_at":"2017-04-10T16:33:22-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"}]}

x-examples.name: Retrieve a list of specific reports

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/reports.json?ids=517154478" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Report.all(
  session: test_session,
  ids: "517154478",
)

response.body: {"reports":[{"id":752357116,"name":"Custom App Report 2","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales ORDER BY total_sales","updated_at":"2022-04-05T13:05:24-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"},{"id":517154478,"name":"Wholesale Sales Report","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today","updated_at":"2017-04-10T16:33:22-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"}]}

x-examples.name: Retrieve a list reports last updated after 2005-07-31 15:57:11 in the EDT timezone

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/reports.json?updated_at_min=2005-07-31+15%3A57%3A11+EDT+-04%3A00" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Report.all(
  session: test_session,
  updated_at_min: "2005-07-31 15:57:11 EDT -04:00",
)

response.body: {"reports":[{"id":752357116,"shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales ORDER BY total_sales"},{"id":517154478,"shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today"}]}

-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Report.all(
  session: test_session,
  fields: "id,shopify_ql",
)

response.body: {"reports":[{"id":517154478,"name":"Wholesale Sales Report","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today","updated_at":"2017-04-10T16:33:22-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"},{"id":752357116,"name":"Custom App Report 2","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales ORDER BY total_sales","updated_at":"2022-04-05T13:05:24-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"}]}

x-examples.name: Retrieve a list all reports after the specified ID

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/reports.json?since_id=123" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Report.all(
  session: test_session,
  since_id: "123",
)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the report. Maximum length: 255 characters.

parameters.name: shopify_ql
parameters.description: The ShopifyQL the report will query.

report.name: A new app report
report.shopify_ql: SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -1m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales

request.body: {"report":{"name":"A new app report","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -1m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales"}}

response.body: {"report":{"id":1016888664,"name":"A new app report","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -1m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales","updated_at":"2022-04-05T13:05:35-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"}}

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"report":{"name":"A new app report","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -1m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales"}}' \
-X POST "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/reports.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

report = ShopifyAPI::Report.new(session: test_session)
report.name = "A new app report"
report.shopify_ql = "SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -1m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales"
report.save()

paths.description: Retrieves a single report created by your app

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.

report.name: Wholesale Sales Report
report.shopify_ql: SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today
SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today

ShopifyAPI::Report.find(

response.body: {"report":{"id":517154478,"shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales WHERE api_client_id == 123 SINCE -1m UNTIL today"}}

x-examples.name: Retrieve a single report, showing only particular fields

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -X GET "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/reports/517154478.json?fields=id%2Cshopify_ql" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

ShopifyAPI::Report.find(

report.name: Changed Report Name
report.shopify_ql: SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -12m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales

request.body: {"report":{"id":517154478,"name":"Changed Report Name","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -12m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales"}}

response.body: {"report":{"name":"Changed Report Name","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -12m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales","id":517154478,"updated_at":"2022-04-05T13:05:37-04:00","category":"custom_app_reports"}}

codeSamples.example_code:
curl -d '{"report":{"id":517154478,"name":"Changed Report Name","shopify_ql":"SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -12m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales"}}' \
-X PUT "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/reports/517154478.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

report = ShopifyAPI::Report.new(session: test_session)
report.id = 517154478
report.name = "Changed Report Name"
report.shopify_ql = "SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -12m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales"
report.save()

curl -X DELETE "https://your-development-store.myshopify.com/admin/api/2022-04/reports/517154478.json" \
-H "X-Shopify-Access-Token: {access_token}"

test_session = ShopifyAPI::Utils::SessionUtils.load_current_session(
  auth_header: request.auth_header,
  cookies: request.cookies,
  is_online: true
)

ShopifyAPI::Report.delete(
  session: test_session,
  id: 517154478,
)

properties.description: The category for the report. When you create a report, the API will return custom_app_reports.
properties.name: category

properties.description: The unique numeric identifier for the report.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The name of the report. Maximum length: 255 characters.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The ShopifyQL query that generates the report. See Shopify Query Language.
properties.example: SHOW total_sales BY order_id FROM sales SINCE -1m UNTIL today ORDER BY total_sales
properties.name: shopify_ql

properties.description: The date and time (ISO 8601) when the report was last modified.
properties.name: updated_at

x-shopify-meta.meta_description: Create, update, and delete reports that appear on the Reports page of the Shopify admin. Each report is built from a query written with Shopify Query Language (ShopifyQL).
